_meta.name: howto-custom-prompts
_meta.description: Write effective prompts for better documentation
_meta.use_case: You want to improve your template prompts

sections.heading: # Prompt Engineering for Documentation
sections.prompt: Introduction to prompt engineering (3-4 paragraphs): (1) Why prompts matter, (2) Common problems (too long, too vague), (3) What makes a good prompt, (4) Overview of techniques. Set expectations.

sections.heading: ## Length Control Techniques
sections.prompt: How to control output length (5-6 paragraphs): (1) Explicit length guidance (3-5 paragraphs), (2) Scope constraints (skip X, focus on Y), (3) Structure hints (bullet lists, numbered steps), (4) Examples with before/after, (5) Common patterns. Be specific with examples.

sections.heading: ## Specificity and Clarity
sections.prompt: Writing clear prompts (4-5 paragraphs): (1) Be explicit about format, (2) Specify what to include, (3) Specify what to exclude, (4) Give examples in prompt. Show good vs bad examples.

sections.heading: ## Source Selection Strategy
sections.prompt: Choosing right sources (4-5 paragraphs): (1) Match sources to section purpose, (2) Specific files vs globs, (3) Avoid too many sources, (4) Testing source effectiveness. Include patterns.

sections.heading: ## Testing and Iteration
sections.prompt: Improving prompts iteratively (3-4 paragraphs): (1) Generate and review, (2) Identify issues, (3) Refine prompts, (4) Re-test. Include iteration workflow.

sections.heading: ## Common Patterns and Anti-Patterns
sections.prompt: What works and what doesn't (5-7 paragraphs): (1) Good patterns (explicit length, clear scope), (2) Anti-patterns (be brief, make it good), (3) Real examples from templates, (4) Quick reference. Be practical.
